articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Patricia Zengerle, Steve Holland
articles.description: The Biden administration has decided to lift a ban on U.S. sales of offensive weapons to Saudi Arabia, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday, reversing a three-year-old policy to pressure the Kingdom to wind down the Yemen war.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to lift ban on offensive weapons sales to Saudi Arabia, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane with 62 people on board crashed in Vinhedo, Brazil, on Friday, local TV station GloboNews reported.
articles.title: Plane crashes in Brazil with 62 people on board, local media reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: When war last came to the edges of Lebanon's capital nearly two decades ago, Bilal Sahlab drove his family to a secluded mountain town, rented an apartment and waited out the bombing.
articles.title: As war drums beat, those in Beirut suburb have nowhere to flee

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Tom Balmforth, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Dozens of Russian military personnel are being trained in Iran to use the Fath-360 close-range ballistic missile system, two European intelligence sources told Reuters, adding that they expected the imminent delivery of hundreds of the satellite-guided weapons to Russia for its war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran to deliver hundreds of ballistic missiles to Russia soon, intel sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on a car deep inside Lebanon killed a senior figure from Palestinian armed group Hamas on Friday evening, a Hamas source and two other security sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills senior Hamas figure in south Lebanon

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: Long-time Bangladeshi leader Sheikh Hasina had not resigned as prime minister before fleeing this week to India as anti-government protesters marched on her official residence, her son and adviser told Reuters early on Saturday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Bangladesh's Hasina did not resign before fleeing to Delhi, says son and adviser

articles.author: Nafisa Eltahir, Khalid Abdelaziz
articles.description: Reuters interviewed 43 people from 20 communities who described a spiral of looting, kidnapping and killing after the group seized most of the state in December.
articles.title: Unruly RSF fighters sow chaos in Sudan's farming heartland

articles.author: Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panamanian President Jose Raul Mulino asked the U.S. to accelerate aid deliveries for repatriating migrants who cross into Panama through the dangerous Darien Gap, as part of the president's efforts to slow migration through the Central American nation.
articles.title: Panama asks the US to expedite resources for repatriating migrants

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Washington is set to provide Israel with $3.5 billion to spend on U.S. weapons and military equipment, releasing the money months after it was appropriated by the U.S. Congress, CNN reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: US releases $3.5 billion to Israel to spend on US weapons, military equipment, CNN reports

articles.author: Michael Holden, Catarina Demony
articles.description: More than 480 people have been arrested for involvement in attacks on Muslim, immigration and other sites as well as police and passersby.
articles.title: King Charles calls for unity and understanding after riots in UK
